20359.「おお <pc>か。\n オーディスならば このところ\n ずっと 自分の部屋に:
Welcome back, <pc>.
Odis has been shut inside his room
for a while now.

20360.「オーディスは 夜を徹して\n 王家の古代文字を 学んでいるようなのだ。\n ラ:
Odis dedicated the entire night to the study
of the ancient script of the royal family,
trying to decipher the tablet of King Ladis.

20361.「わらわは あえて 手を貸していないが\n 根を詰めすぎては 身体に悪い。\n:
I have refrained from offering my assistance,
but he is pushing himself too hard. Could you
please check up on him?

20362.「ワシが 様子を見にいったこともあるが\n ジャマだからと 追い返されてしまって:
I already tried checking on him, but he turned
me away, saying I was distracting him.

20363.「父親として 苦労している息子のために\n 何もできないのは 忍びないが\n こ:
As a father, it pains me to see my son
struggling. So, I'll leave this to you!

20364.「<pc>殿に 見てもらえれば\n わらわも 安心できる。\n オーディスのこと:
It would ease my anxiety if you could go and
check on him. Please keep an eye on him,
won't you?

20366.「……僕は やったぞ。\n この石版を すべて 読み解くことができた。:
...I did it. I managed to decipher
all of these stone tablets.

20367.「ラーディス王が 歌を消し去らず\n あえて 封印することを選んだのは なぜか？:
Why did King Ladis choose to seal the song
rather than erase it? I've been wondering
about that, but I finally figured it out.

20368.「封印のことを わざわざ 書き残したのは\n 後に それを解こうとする者が現れる:
The reason he went to the trouble of placing
the seal was because he foresaw that someone
would eventually attempt to unseal it.

20369.「これは ラーディス王からの挑戦なんだ。\n 男王を目指す者よ 封印を解けるもの:
This is a challenge from King Ladis. He says,
"Those who aim to become king, if you can
break the seal, then try as you might..."

20370.「この石版には こう書かれている。\n ……シェルナーの五声に 私は誓った。\n:
The stone tablet reads like this...
"I pledged to the five voices of the Shellner.
I will bury the song within itself..."

20371.「この文章は 男王の唄う育みの歌を\n 封印した場所を 示していると思うんだ。:
I think this text indicates where they sealed
the Song of Nurture sung by the male kings.

20372.「君も知っているかもしれないが シェルナーとは\n レーンという村の 結婚の立会:
You might already know this, but the
Shellner refers to the witness at weddings
in that village called Lane.

20373.「そのシェルナーが 男王の歌に\n どんな関係があるのかは わからない。:
I don't know what the Shellner has to do with
the king's song, though.

20374.「だから 僕は レーンの村に確かめにいく。\n <pc>君に 同行してもらいたい:
I want to go to Lane Village so I can find out
more. Would you accompany me there,
<pc>?

20375.「ありがとう <pc>君！\n 君がいてくれて 本当に助かる。:
Thank you! Your presence is a really big help
to me.

20376.「ここから先は 調査員たちを使わずに\n 僕と <pc>君の ふたりで\n こと:
From here on, I'd like to proceed with this
matter together on our own, without the
researchers. Thanks again!

20377.「そういえば <pc>君は\n レーンの村の出身じゃなかったか？\n シェルナー:
Come to think of it, aren't you from Lane
Village, <pc>? Do you know
anything about the Shellner?

20378.「……そうか。君は アーシクとキールという\n 夫婦のシェルナーをやったのか。\:
...I see. You were the Shellner for a couple
named Aashik and Keel. But you don't know
anything more than that, right?

20379.「僕は シェルナーのことを レーンの村の者に\n 手当たり次第に 聞いてみるつも:
I'm going to ask around in Lane Village
about the Shellner. I'd appreciate it if you
could do the same.

20380.「では すぐに出発するぞ。\n <pc>君も レーンの村へ急いでくれ！:
I'll be departing immediately. Please hurry to
Lane Village!

20381.「頼みを聞いてくれるのは ありがたいが……。\n 君は かなりの数の頼まれごとを:
I appreciate your willingness, but you seem to
be busy with other requests.

20382.「先約があるならば 今は あきらめよう。\n 僕は ここで 調査を続けるから\n:
If you have prior commitments, let's give up
for now. I'll continue my research here, so
please come back later.

20383.「<pc>君ならば 僕の頼みを\n 聞いてくれると思ったんだが……。:
I thought you'd be willing to help me...
If you change your mind, please come back.

20384.「僕は ここで 調査を続けるから\n 気が変わったならば また来てほしい。:
I will continue my research here, so if you
change your mind, please come back.

20385.「おお。<pc>君か……。\n チカラを貸す気に なってくれたか。:
Oh. <pc>, you're here. You've
finally decided to lend a helping hand, have
you?

20386.「この石版には こう書かれている。\n ……シェルナーの五声に 私は誓った。\n:
The stone tablet reads like this...
"I pledged to the five voices of the Shellner.
I will bury the song within itself..."

20387.「君も知っているかもしれないが シェルナーとは\n レーンという村の 結婚の立会:
You might already know this, but the
Shellner refers to the witness at weddings
in that village called Lane.

20388.「そのシェルナーが 男王の歌に\n どんな関係があるのかは わからない。:
I don't know what the Shellner has to do with
the king's song, though.

20389.「だから 僕は レーンの村に確かめにいく。\n <pc>君に 同行してもらいたい:
I want to go to Lane Village so I can find out
more. Would you accompany me there,
<pc>?

20390.「おお <pc>君。\n 君も この家に 来ていたか。:
Oh, <pc>. I didn't realize you were
here, too.

20391.「これは おどろいた。本当に王子様だ。\n いったい なんの用で うちなんかに…:
Well, this is quite the surprise. It really is
the prince. What business could you
possibly have in a place like this...?

20392.「この村の夫婦に シェルナーというものについて\n 聞いてまわっているところだ。:
I'm asking around about something called
the Shellner among the village's couples.
Do you know anything about it?

20393.「はあ……。シェルナーというのは\n この村に伝わる ならわしで\n 結婚する者:
Hm... The Shellner is a tradition in this
village. It's a role where you act as a
witness at a wedding...

20394.「それは 僕も知っている。\n もっと他に シェルナーについて\n あなたが 知:
We already know that. Is there anything
else you can tell us about it?

20397.「死んだ祖父が シェルナーをやったようで。\n 今のシェルナーは 本来のシェルナ:
My late grandfather was one. I've heard tales
suggesting that the original Shellner had a
different role compared to those of today.

20398.「おおっ それは 興味深い話だ。\n ぜひ 聞かせてくれ！:
Oh, that's quite an intriguing story.
I'd love to hear more about it!

20399.「祖父の話によれば シェルナーってのは\n もともとは このウェナ諸島を守る勇士:
According to my grandfather, the Shellner was
originally a name given to brave warriors who
protected the Wena Islands.

20400.「勇士になる者は シエラ巡礼地って場所で\n 儀式をしなきゃならないんだとか。:
Those who become brave warriors must
perform a ritual at a place called the
Sierra Pilgrimage Site.

20401.「そんで 勇士には シェルナーって名前が\n 与えられたっていう もっともらしい:
Then, the warriors are given the title of
Shellner, or that's what the story suggests.
I can't vouch for its authenticity, though.

20402.「オレが聞いたのは こんなもんです。\n すみませんね 王子様。:
That is all I've heard about it. I apologize
for the limited information, Your Highness.

20403.「いや じゅうぶんだ。\n ありがとう。後で 礼を届けさせる。:
No, it's quite plenty. Thank you. I will
make sure to express my gratitude later.

20404.「いえいえ お礼なんて とんでもない！\n お役に立てたなら 光栄ですんで。:
No need for thanks at all! I would be
delighted to be of assistance if I can.

20405.「シエラ巡礼地というのは 実在している。\n たしか この島の北にある場所が そ:
The Sierra Pilgrimage Site does exist. I
believe it's located to the north of this
island. His story might be true.

20406.「ならば ラーディス王の石版に書かれた\n シェルナーの五声というのも シエラ巡:
In that case, we can assume that the five voices of the Shellner written on King Ladis' tablet are also related to the Sierra
Pilgrimage Site.

20407.「さっそく 確かめにいってみよう！\n レーナム緑野の北東が シエラ巡礼地のはず:
Let's go check it out right away! You should
be able to get there if you go northeast of
Lenam Fields. Come on, let's go!

20408.「ここが シエラ巡礼地か。\n はじめて来たが 何か\n 不思議な感じのする所だ:
So this is the Sierra Pilgrimage Site.
Although it's my first time here, I feel
something strangely intriguing about it...

20409.「僕は ヴェリナードの王子 オーディス。\n あなたは ここで 何をしている？:
I am Prince Odis of Verinard.
What are you doing here?

20410.「私は ナフナー。\n 五声の祈りを捧げる シェルナーの案内人。\n だが もは:
I am Nafuna, and my role is to guide the
Shellner who offers a prayer to the five
voices. However, my role has come to an end...

20411.「シェルナーのチカラ……。\n それは 失われた 古のチカラ。\n そなたは そ:
The power of the Shellner is an ancient
power that has been lost through time.
Is this what you seek?

20412.「ナフナー殿。僕は シェルナーではなく\n 王になるために ここに来た。:
Mr. Nafuna, I am not here as a Shellner.
I came here to become a king.

20413.「シェルナーの五声とは\n 何を指す言葉なのか 教えてくれないか？:
Can you tell me about the meaning of
the Five Voices of Shellner?

20414.「五声とは 我らの発する声の持つチカラ。\n すなわち 『呼』『言』『歌』『哭』:
The five voices are the power of our voice. In other words, it is the expression of our five thoughts: "call," "say," "sing," "wail," and
"moan.

20416.「五声の中には 『歌』があるんだな……。\n 石版にあった 歌は 歌に葬るという:
So there is a "song" in the five voices... I wonder if this is what the Tablet was referring to when it said that the song is
buried in the song.

20417.「五声の地は シエラ巡礼地に 散らばる。\n 巡礼者は 自らの足で 五声を求め\:
The Five Voices are scattered across the Sierra Pilgrimage Site. Pilgrims seek the Five Voices with their own feet, and after the
ritual, they become Shellner.

20418.「……なるほど。五声の中の『歌』は\n このシエラ巡礼地に あるということだな。:
I see. So the Song of the Five Voices is here
in the Sierra Pilgrimage Site. Then let's look
for it.

20419.「五声を伝える 五人の神官。\n 彼らのひとりが 『歌』を伝えるだろう。:
Five Priests who will deliver the Five Voices.
One of them will deliver the Song.

20420.「ありがとう ナフナー殿。\n 話を聞かせてくれて 感謝する。:
Thank you, Mr. Nafuna. Thank you for sharing
your story with us.

20421.「このシエラ巡礼地のどこかに\n 五声の中の 『歌』にまつわる場所がある。\n:
Somewhere in this Sierra Pilgrimage Site is a
place associated with the Song of the Five
Voices. Let's try to find it <pc>.

20422.「<pc>君。どうやら\n 目的の場所を 見つけてくれたようだな。:
<pc>. Looks like you found what you
were looking for.

20423.「ヴェリナードの王子 オーディスだ。\n あなたが 五声の『歌』を伝える神官か。:
I am Odis, Prince of Verinard. You are the
Priest who delivers the Song of the Five
Voices.

20424.「……いかにも。私はソヌーグ。\n 五声の教えを 今に伝える者なり。:
...indeed. I am Sonugu. I am the one to pass
on the teachings of the Five Voices to the
present.

20425.「五声のひとつ 『歌』の声。\n 言葉を音に乗せ 思いをつむぐ声なり。:
The voice of "Song" is one of the five voices.
It puts words to sound and connects thoughts.

20426.「あなたは この言葉に心当たりはないだろうか？\n ……シェルナーの五声に 私は:
Do these words ring a bell with you? In the
five voices of Shellner, I made a vow. "Let
the song be buried in the song.

20427.「その言葉を どのようにして お知りになった？: How did you come to know that word?

20428.「最後の男王 ラーディス王が残した石版を\n 手に入れたんだ。そこに書かれていた:
I received a Tablet left by the last male
king, King Ladis. These are the words that
were written on it.

20429.「僕は 王になるために\n 封印された男王の育みの歌を 探している。\n 知って:
I'm looking for the nurturing song of a sealed
man-king to become king. Will you tell me what
you know?

20430.「かつて 私の先祖が 時の王より命を受けた。\n 男の王を目指す者 現れし時……:
My ancestors were once commanded by the king
of time. "When you see a man who aspires to be
King of Men you must give him this.

20431.「今が その時なり。\n これを そなたに授けよう……。: Now is the time. I give you this...

20432.「やはり ラーディス王は 男の王を\n 目指す者が現れると 予見していたのか……:
After all, King Ladis had foreseen that
someone would emerge who would aspire to be
king of men...

20433.「…………おお……歌だ。\n 僕の知らない歌が 書かれているぞ！！:
Oh... a song. It's got a song on it that I
don't know!

20434.「歌の名は……導きの歌。\n 聖なる加護を 諸島に導くという内容だ。\n 男王の:
The name of the song is...Song of Guidance. It's about bringing holy blessings to the islands. It's a nurturing song sung by a male
king!

20435.「まさか こんなに あっさりと\n 見つかるとは 思っていなかった……。: I didn't expect it to be so easy to find...

20436.「この歌が 恵みの歌と 同じ効果を出せれば\n 僕は 王になる資格を得たことにな:
If this song has the same effect as the song
of blessing, then I am qualified to be king! I
must return to the castle and get ready.

20437.「<pc>君。いろいろと手伝ってもらい\n 君には 感謝の言葉もない。\n 報酬:
<pc>. I can't thank you enough for
all your help. I hope you will accept this as
your reward.

20438.「僕は 王となって この諸島を守っていこう。\n かつて シェルナーという勇士が:
I will be king and protect this archipelago.
As a brave warrior named Shellner once did.
